c74object.name: fl.trace~
c74object.digest: Outputs values from the input as audio, continuing the last value till a new frame arrives
c74object.description: The mode parameter determines which value or values from the frame are output. This object is intended for passing control signals to the host environment at audio rate. The length of the internal buffer determines the maximum frame length for full output. Output suffers no latency but an optional delay may be added if desired. If a delay is applied then the maximum frame length will be reduced by the delay time.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode used for output:
[0] - full - outputs the entire frame in full.[1] - first - output the first sample of the frame only.[2] - last - output the last sample of the frame only.[3] - specified - output the sample specified by index using the position parameter.[4] - ratio - output the sample specified by the position parameter as a ratio of the frame length.

entry.name: /buffer_size [instantiation double]
entry.description: Sets the internal buffer size in the units specified by the units parameter.

entry.name: /units [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the time units used to determine the buffer size and delay.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds

entry.name: /position [double]
entry.description: Sets the position of the output sample in specified or ratio mode. Note that positions out of range will be clipped tp the input frame (to the first or last position).

entry.name: /delay [double]
entry.description: Sets the output delay in the units specified by the units parameter.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.trace~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: process
method.description:
Process a non-realtime network,advancing time by the number of samples specified by the required length argument.
This will only take effect if the object has its rt attribute set to 0 More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets a non-realtime network to the start of time ready for processing, optionally setting the sample rate. If the sample rate is omitted it will be set to the global sample rate.
This will only take effect if fl.trace~ has its rt attribute set to 0. More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: buffer
attribute.description:
Sets the non-realtime buffer~ for fl.trace~. This is the buffer~ used for IO in a non-realtime setting.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.trace~. When set to 0 fl.trace~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.trace~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
